banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Not good with names: Local name customs in a global village
videoData.socialTitle: Not good with names: Local name customs in a global village

nodes.whoTheyAre: Since migrating from Singapore at the age of 10, Ma Shwe Sin Win (Cynthia) has noticed how much names impact on how we interact with one another. From school to boardroom, she has made it a point to reflect on what happens when we enforce norms each day. Win manages relationships of FX Connect and Currenex clients for State Street Global Exchange in South East Asia. She’s also a committee member with the Professional Women’s Network of State Street Singapore.

videoData.description: When Ma Shwe Sin Win (Cynthia) received a LinkedIn request from her father, she ignored it – because she didn't realize it was from him. Forced into the Western first and last name format, her father's Burmese name transformed into something she didn't even recognize. In this playful talk, Ma Shwe Sin Win reflects on naming practices, and thinks about what happens locally when we enforce norms on a global scale.
